page.title: 01Around Kirkby La Thorpe
page.content: The elevated position of Evedons squat church offers a view of small fields across by numerous drainage channels and a landscape largely devoid of hedges. Only small copses and the occasional pasture offer a variation of land use. So flat is the land that Evedons sturdy red brick water tower is an imposing landmark. The River Slea flows though the area in the North west with Papermill Lock being sited on a public footpath to the town of Slaford. Kirkby-la Thorpe to the south is a slightly larger settlement wit limited new housebuiling though the village is now dissected by the busy A17 Sleaford by pss. A little further east of this road Asgarbys few houses are dominated by its huge church spire. In surrounding pasture land stand a host of isolaed deciduous trees amongst the
